snippet: The central bank said 15 of 19 could weather a sharp downturn, but the industry’s recovery is uneven.
abstract: Federal Reserve announces results of its latest round of stress tests, noting that 5 of the 19 largest financial firms had enough capital to withstand severe recession; announcement paves the way for JPMorgan Chase and other banks to bolster dividends and buy back shares; results underscore the uneven nature of the industry recovery, with some firms proving resilient, while others remain on shaky ground.

byline.original: By PETER EAVIS and J. B. SILVER-GREENBERG

lead_paragraph: The central bank said 15 of 19 could weather a sharp downturn, but the industry’s recovery is uneven.

headline.main: 15 of 19 Big Banks Pass Fed’s Latest Stress Test
headline.print_headline: Most Banks, But Not All, Pass the Fed’s Stress Tests
